org.eclipse.january.dataset

Interface IDatasetConnector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDynamicShape, IFileConnection

    public interface IDatasetConnector
extends IFileConnection, IDynamicShape
    A dataset connector contains a lazy dataset which exists in a remote location. It uses a connection to the DataServer to provide the implementation of the slicing required remotely. You may also listen to data changing in the dataset

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.eclipse.january.dataset.IDynamicShape

        UNLIMITED

    • Method Detail

      • getDatasetName

        String getDatasetName()
        The dataset location/name in the file
        Returns:
        Dataset name

      • setDatasetName

        void setDatasetName(String datasetName)
        The dataset location/name in the file
        Parameters:
        datasetName -

      • setWritingExpected

        void setWritingExpected(boolean expectWrite)
        If set to true the DataServer will not cache the dataset. If left as false: if the data server can figure out that the file is writing, it will reshape. However it cannot always determine this depending on the file and what is writing to it (SWMR can write without changing date stamp for instance) Setting this boolean ensures that a given path, never will cache on the data server. Default value is false for MJPG streams and true for standard remote datasets.
        Parameters:
        expectWrite -

      • isWritingExpected

        boolean isWritingExpected()
        Returns:
        true if the remote dataset has been warned that writing is expected.

      • connect

        String connect()
        throws DatasetException
        Same as calling connect(500, TimeUnit.MILLISECOND) Cannot will connect with the DataServer to start listening to any updates to the file should it be written in the remote file system. When connect it called, the remote file must exist and the dataset properties are read. These properties must not change in the file while you are connected. For instance if the file is ints when you connect, it must not change data class.
        Returns:
        the name of the thread started to run the connection or null if each event is driven from the event thread of the service (for instance web sockets provide the thread and this runs the connection)
        Throws:
        DatasetException

      • connect

        String connect(long time,
               TimeUnit unit)
        throws DatasetException
        Cannot will connect with the DataServer to start listening to any updates to the file should it be written in the remote file system. When connect it called, the remote file must exist and the dataset properties are read. These properties must not change in the file while you are connected. For instance if the file is ints when you connect, it must not change data class.
        Parameters:
        time -
        unit -
        Returns:
        the name of the thread started to run the connection or null if each event is driven from the event thread of the service (for instance web sockets provide the thread and this runs the connection)
        Throws:
        DatasetException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws DatasetException
        Stops listening to the dataset changing and disconnects from the server. A remote dataset may be connected and disconnected multiple times.
        Throws:
        DatasetException
